Package com.tiborszabo.quizapp.managers

Class QuestionnaireManager

java.lang.Object
com.tiborszabo.quizapp.managers.QuestionnaireManager
public class QuestionnaireManager extends Object
QuestionnaireManager can be used to hold, evaluate and display the contents of the Question objects into the application.
Author:
Tibor Peter Szabo.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuestionnaireManager

      public QuestionnaireManager()
      Initializes the QuestionManager object.

  • Method Details

    • setQuestions

      public void setQuestions(List<Question> questions)
      Sets question of the object to question.
      Parameters:
      questions - List of Questions, which will be set into the object.

    • evaluate

      public Boolean evaluate()
      Evaluates the currently active question.
      Returns:
      if the question was answered correctly.

    • next

      public boolean next()
      Advances the questionIndex, and returns if there are any question left.
      Returns:
      Boolean, if any question left.

    • show

      public void show(android.content.Context context, android.widget.ScrollView descriptionView, android.widget.LinearLayout answerView)
      Displays the content of the Question object onto the inputted holding View objects.
      Parameters:
      context - type of android.content.Context, it is used as a context for the newly created elements.
      descriptionView - holds the a ScrollView layout, that will hold the question.
      answerView - holds a LinearLayout, that will hold the answering View objects.

    • getQuestion

      public Question getQuestion()
      Gets the current question.
      Returns:
      Question, the current question.

    • getAll

      public int getAll()
      Returns the number of all failed or completed questions.
      Returns:
      Integer, number of completed or failed question.

    • getCorrect

      public int getCorrect()
      Returns the number of correct question.
      Returns:
      Integer, the number of correctly answered question.
